Write an integer function RootCount(A, B, C) that returns the amount of roots of the quadratic equation A·x2 + B·x + C = 0 (A, B, C are real-valued parameters, A ≠ 0). Using this function, find the amount of roots for each of three quadratic equations with given coefficients. Note that the amount of roots is determined by the value of a discriminant: D = B2 − 4·A·C.
